image.altText: A large housing construction site with multiple excavators on the edge of a bush block.

props.synopsis: The second stage of Canberra suburb Denman Prospect was set to be built on Bluetts Block in the Molonglo Valley, but it has now been declared a nature reserve to preserve its ecological value.

title.children: 'Lovely piece of bushland' at Canberra's edge spared from development

image.altText: Two men in an office monitoring traffic on a large video board.

props.synopsis: Road authorities are urging Canberra drivers to avoid taking illegal and potentially dangerous shortcuts to avoid increased peak hour traffic due to the closure of the western side of London Circuit for light rail construction.

title.children: Traffic congestion prompts ACT authorities to take action on illegal driving

image.altText: A man with grey hair stands outside smiling.

props.synopsis: Almost a century after it was taken from Gamilaraay country in New South Wales, a sacred tree known as a dhulu is returned by a Swiss museum.

title.children: Sacred tree returned to Australia after eight decades in Swiss museum

image.altText: exterior view of aged care facility

props.synopsis: Access to respite aged care in Canberra will become even tougher from June, when the ACT government will shut a 15-bed facility in Canberra's south.Â

title.children: Aged care respite facility to be shut despite growing demand

image.altText: Judge Salvatore Vasta

props.synopsis: Federal Circuit Court Judge Salvatore Vasta has won his High Court bid for immunity from being sued by a man wrongly jailed during a family property dispute.

title.children: Federal Circuit Court Judge wins High Court bid for immunity

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: Dawson has lodged a special leave application in the High Court, as he seeks to secure a new trial, 40 years after he killed his wife.Â

title.children: Convicted killer Chris Dawson launches High Court appeal bid

image.altText: Shorten stands speaking in the prime minister's courtyard.

props.synopsis: A speechwriter hired on a $600,000, two-year contract to write speeches for Services Australia and its minister Bill Shorten, has joined him at his new job at the University of Canberra.

title.children: Bill Shorten's $300k speechwriter follows him to University of Canberra

image.altText: outside view of federal court in australia

props.synopsis: A group of Canberra's social housing tenants are set to get their day in the Federal Court, with the way cleared for a class action against the ACT government over a plan to move them from their homes.

title.children: Class action by social housing tenants cleared to run

image.altText: an old man sits on a walking aid

props.synopsis: Former Christian Brother John Vincent Roberts, 83, has pleaded guilty to three counts of indecent assault which took place when he took his 15-year-old victim on drives to a forest.

title.children: Teenage boy 'empty inside' after being assaulted by teacher in 1980s

image.altText: us president donald trump holds a signed executive order for tariffs increase

props.synopsis: The tariffs were not going into effect immediately but could begin to be imposed within weeks as Trump's trade and economic team study bilateral tariff and trade relationships.

title.children: Trump unveils roadmap for reciprocal tariffs on US allies and competitors

image.altText: Image of two people, one claiming to be NSW Health worker, talking to content creator

props.synopsis: The Israeli content creator who posted a video showing two Sydney nurses make threats towards Israeli patients has shared another clip from the interaction, with police awaiting the full unedited video.

title.children: 'Nothing to hide': Israeli content creator shares longer video of Sydney nurses

image.altText: Man smiling at press conference

props.synopsis: Offshore wind is proving a key challenge for the government, with hecklers interrupting the prime minister's announcement of Labor's new candidate in the Illawarra.

title.children: PM heckled as wind farms remain key battleground in Labor heartland

image.altText: A man in handcuffs

props.synopsis: Leonard John Warwick, sentenced over three murders and a series of bombings in the 1980s, has died aged 78 at Long Bay Hospital on Friday morning.

title.children: Sydney's Family Court bomber dies while serving life in jail

image.altText: A photo of a man with a beard.

props.synopsis: New data obtained by the ABC has found First Nations and diverse communities were disproportionately represented in New South Wales police searches between 2020 and 2023.

title.children: Indigenous and diverse communities disproportionately searched in NSW

image.altText: Joel Selwood speaks into a microphone at a lectern behind the coffin of his brother, Troy Selwood.

props.synopsis: Troy Selwood is eulogised by AFL-playing brothers Adam, Scott and Joel in a memorial service at Geelong Cats home ground Kardinia Park.

title.children: 'He put up a hell of a fight': Troy Selwood farewelled by AFL-playing brothers

image.altText: Houthi fighters with guns walk in a group in red dirt chanting.

props.synopsis: Yemen's Houthi rebels are proving they are a threat that won't go away easily, continuously warning to escalate attacks against Israel and Red Sea shipping if the Gaza ceasefire collapses. Â

title.children: Even if ceasefire holds, Houthi rebels remain 'a threat that won't disappear'

image.altText: Cbus super logo on a glass window

props.synopsis: The inquiry recommends better protections for members when claiming death and disability benefits and calls for more transparency around how super funds including Cbus appoint to their boards and spend money.Â

title.children: Senate inquiry calls for an overhaul of $4 trillion super industry

image.altText: Matthew Farrell smiles looking at the camera while sitting in the cockpit of a small aeroplane.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest administrator of pilots, maintainers and aircraft acted unreasonably in the lead-up to and during an inquest into a deadly crash, a Victorian coroner has found.

title.children: Coroner finds fatal crash pilot's licence should never have been issued

image.altText: A police car is seen parked outside of Lynbrook shopping centre.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police says officers were attempting to arrest the man "when he fled on foot inside a shopping centre" before he was found shortly after with life-threatening injuries.

title.children: Man dies after fleeing attempted arrest in south-east Melbourne, police say

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: People with luggage waiting at Sydney Airport, near the train station, being instructed by two people in orange hi-vis vests

props.synopsis: A text message signed by an RTBU convenor appears to have advised Sydney train workers to stay at home and "f--k the network up".

title.children: Union official tells Sydney train workers 'don't show up' amid industrial action

image.altText: Burnt rubble of a house behind police tape.

props.synopsis: A Victorian man, who has pleaded not guilty to murder, admitted he had burnt his house down while someone was inside, the Supreme Court has heard.

title.children: Court hears man confessed to burning down home with someone inside

image.altText: Film still of Sonic the Hedgehog flying through very blue air, arms back, eyes angry

props.synopsis: A children's action romp, a violent revenge flick, an erotic thriller: these are our favourite films to watch on Valentine's Day that aren't rom-coms.

title.children: Forget The Notebook, try these unconventional Valentine's Day films

image.altText: Caiden Cleary of the Swans reaches for the ball, running at full speed in an AFL match

props.synopsis: Sydney Swans youngster Caiden Cleary is "extremely remorseful" after being suspended for the opening two rounds of the AFL season for conduct unbecoming.

title.children: Swans teenager suspended for two matches 'for conduct unbecoming'

image.altText: Jamie Cripps celebrates a goal for West Coast against Adelaide

props.synopsis: Dynamic pricing means AFL fans in Adelaide may pay double what they would pay for a general admission ticket at the MCG or Docklands Stadium, as the federal government considers feedback on plans to ban the practice.Â

title.children: Criticism of 'unfair' dynamic pricing prompts calls to standardise AFL tickets

image.altText: A large, colourful demountable with 'Victoria's Container Deposit Scheme' written on the side.

props.synopsis: Reusing glass and plastic instead of recycling it used to be common â and still is in some parts of the world. Could it be part of the solution to Australia's waste problem?

title.children: Returning to reusing glass could help reduce Australia's recycling problem

image.altText: A man in a suit in conversation during a parliamentary committee hearing

props.synopsis: Queensland MPs will receive a new allowance of up to $6,500 for home security measures in the wake of "very disturbing" threats.

title.children: 'Very disturbing' threats prompt new security allowance for Queensland MPs

image.altText: woman with laptop, headache and burnout on sofa, frustrated and annoyed at home

props.synopsis: Wading through what's on offer and what applies to you can be confusing. Here's some advice to help with getting started.

title.children: How to find and decide what first home buyer incentives work for you

image.altText: a woman holding a metal sheet

props.synopsis: A group of "guerilla gardeners" have barricaded themselves in a community garden in response to the Queensland government's attempt to close the site due to contamination concerns.

title.children: Police respond as protesters create blockade at Brisbane community garden

image.altText: A person taking a photo of a car with an emergency service vehicle in the background

props.synopsis: German police have arrested an Afghan asylum seeker after his car rammed into a crowd and injured about 30 people â some of whom remain in a serious condition. Here's what we know.

title.children: Dozens injured as car rams into crowd in Munich â how it unfolded

image.altText: Whale coming out of the ocean

props.synopsis: Luckily, the kayaker, Adrian Simancas came out unscathed despite being fully enclosed inside the whale's mouth.

title.children: Huge humpback whale swallows and spits out Chilean kayaker

image.altText: CCTV shows an elderly woman chasing a home invader, who wears a hoodie to cover their face.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane grandmother managed to grab her handbag from the intruder, who made off with her purse and jewellery.Â

title.children: 91yo woman who chased off intruder wanted to 'belt him over the ears'

image.altText: A smiling young girl in a park.

props.synopsis: Elizabeth died after her insulin was withheld. Her body was found at her Toowoomba home, west of Brisbane, in January 2022.

title.children: Religious group 'arrogantly' put their faith above 8yo's life, court told

image.altText: A bulldog wearing a colourful head piece

props.synopsis: Have you been paying attention to the news this week? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Westminster dog show, Trump tariffs and hapless crocodiles
